title: Challenges and Criticisms of Time Banking

questions.question: What is one of the primary challenges facing time banking in terms of sustainability?
questions.answer: Securing consistent funding

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT typically a source of funding for time banks?
questions.answer: Stock market investments

questions.question: What is a common issue in maintaining member engagement in time banks?
choices: Initial enthusiasm followed by declining participation
Too much enthusiasm overwhelming the system
questions.answer: Initial enthusiasm followed by declining participation

questions.question: Which of the following is a strategy for balancing supply and demand of skills in a time bank?
choices: Skill-matching algorithms in time banking software
Requiring all members to offer the same services
Implementing a monetary fee for high-demand skills
questions.answer: Skill-matching algorithms in time banking software

questions.question: What is a potential tax implication for time banking?
choices: Time credits viewed as taxable income
Time banks required to pay corporate taxes
Members receiving tax deductions for participation
Time credits exempt from all taxation
questions.answer: Time credits viewed as taxable income

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a typical insurance or liability concern in time banking?
questions.answer: Currency exchange rate fluctuations

questions.question: What is a core tenet of time banking regarding the valuation of hours?
choices: Hours are valued based on market rates
Skilled labor is worth more hours
questions.answer: All hours are valued equally

questions.question: What is a potential conflict between time banking principles and market economy values?
choices: Difficulty in assessing the 'true value' of services
Time banking generating too much profit
questions.answer: Difficulty in assessing the 'true value' of services

questions.question: Which of the following is a strategy for addressing the challenge of highly skilled vs. low-skilled contributions?
choices: Focusing on the intrinsic value of all contributions to community well-being
Excluding low-skilled members from the time bank
Requiring all members to obtain professional certifications
Implementing a monetary fee for high-skill services
questions.answer: Focusing on the intrinsic value of all contributions to community well-being

questions.question: What is an important consideration when adapting time banking to local cultural norms in Timor-Leste?
choices: Traditional forms of reciprocity and community support
Elimination of all existing cultural practices
Mandatory participation for all community members
questions.answer: Traditional forms of reciprocity and community support

questions.question: Which of the following is a potential source of resistance to time banking in a new community?
choices: Concerns about exploitation or hidden agendas
Fear of earning too much income
questions.answer: Concerns about exploitation or hidden agendas

questions.question: What is a strategy for integrating time banking with existing community structures?
choices: Collaborating with local NGOs, churches, and community groups
Implementing a top-down approach without community input
questions.answer: Collaborating with local NGOs, churches, and community groups

questions.question: What is a criticism of time banking regarding its economic impact?
choices: Limited scope compared to traditional economic systems
Causing rapid inflation in local economies
Eliminating the need for traditional currency
questions.answer: Limited scope compared to traditional economic systems

questions.question: Which of the following is a concern about the potential reinforcement of social inequalities in time banking?
choices: Favoring those with more free time or a wider range of skills
questions.answer: Favoring those with more free time or a wider range of skills

questions.question: What is a challenge related to the scalability of time banking?
choices: Too rapid growth overwhelming global economies
Excessive profitability leading to corporate takeovers
questions.answer: Effectiveness beyond small, localized communities

questions.question: Which of the following is a best practice for data protection in time banking?
questions.answer: Secure, encrypted databases

questions.question: What is a potential challenge when introducing time banking in Timor-Leste?
choices: Adapting to hierarchical structures in Timorese society
questions.answer: Adapting to hierarchical structures in Timorese society

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT typically a role of local leaders in promoting time banking?
choices: Setting exchange rates for time credits
Helping adapt the system to local customs
questions.answer: Setting exchange rates for time credits

questions.question: What is a potential benefit of time banking in preserving traditional knowledge?
choices: Facilitating the sharing of traditional Timorese skills
Replacing traditional practices with modern alternatives
Documenting traditional knowledge in academic journals
Commercializing traditional practices for global markets
questions.answer: Facilitating the sharing of traditional Timorese skills

questions.question: Which of the following is a strategy for addressing the challenge of seasonal fluctuations in service needs?
choices: Encouraging members to learn and offer new skills
Shutting down the time bank during off-seasons
Implementing surge pricing for high-demand seasons
questions.answer: Encouraging members to learn and offer new skills

questions.question: What is a potential challenge in implementing digital time banking platforms in rural Timor-Leste?
questions.answer: Limited technological infrastructure

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a typical method for maintaining member engagement in time banks?
choices: Offering monetary bonuses for active participation
Regular community events and social gatherings
Continuous outreach and recruitment of new members
questions.answer: Offering monetary bonuses for active participation

questions.question: What is a potential challenge in balancing equality and skill valuation in time banking?
choices: Disincentivizing the offering of high-skill services
Encouraging specialization in a single skill
Mandating equal skill levels for all members
questions.answer: Disincentivizing the offering of high-skill services

questions.question: Which of the following is a strategy for addressing legal challenges in time banking?
choices: Advocacy for clear legal status of time banking exchanges
Operating exclusively in the informal economy
Requiring all members to be legal professionals
questions.answer: Advocacy for clear legal status of time banking exchanges

questions.question: What is a potential challenge in integrating time banking with the formal economy in Timor-Leste?
choices: Tension between time banking principles and market-based valuation
Immediate acceptance by all economic institutions
Automatic integration with international financial systems
questions.answer: Tension between time banking principles and market-based valuation

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a typical sustainability issue in time banking?
choices: Balancing supply and demand of skills
questions.answer: Excessive profitability

questions.question: What is a potential challenge in implementing time banking in a community primarily based on subsistence agriculture?
choices: Integrating time banking with existing economic activities
questions.answer: Integrating time banking with existing economic activities

questions.question: Which of the following is a strategy for building trust in a new time banking initiative?
choices: Starting with small-scale, visible projects to demonstrate benefits
Excluding local leaders from the planning process
Implementing the system without community consultation
questions.answer: Starting with small-scale, visible projects to demonstrate benefits

questions.question: What is a potential challenge in maintaining the principle of all hours being equal in a time bank?
choices: Perceived unfairness in complex or demanding tasks
questions.answer: Perceived unfairness in complex or demanding tasks

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a typical role within a time bank?
questions.answer: Financial investor
